title: (Pwn2Own) Synology RT6600ax dhcpd Command Injection Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows network-adjacent attackers to execute arbitrary code on affected installations of Synology RT6600ax routers. Authentication is not required to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within the dhcpd binary. The issue results from the lack of proper validation of a user-supplied string before using it to execute a system call. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of root.
addtionnal_details: Synology has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://www.synology.com/en-global/security/advisory/Synology_SA_22_25
timeline:
2023-01-24 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2023-05-17 - Coordinated public release of advisory
